abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Growth Support Project
            for Mail were as follows: outcomes were unsatisfactory, risk
            to development outcome was high, Bank performance was
            unsatisfactory, and Borrower performance was unsatisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: the Mali Growth Project was
            too complex and should have been simplified at the design
            and the restructuring stage. The wide scope of project
            activities led to a situation whereby institutional
            coordination was fragmented and at times implementation was
            captured by sectoral interests. Restructuring and Mid-Term
            Review (MTR) are important opportunities to review and
            revise project design. Strong monitoring and evaluation
            system is critical to drive and account for results.
            Specialists on the World Bank and government side need to
            design and supervise implementation of any monitoring and
            evaluation system. The Strategies et Techniques d'Envol
            des Entreprises (STEP) program showed that results can be
            monitored in all the six years of its implementation.
            Clinics on procurement and on financial management should be
            held at any moment in the project, when issues arise. World
            Bank team members can have advice from senior staff in
            safeguards and procurement in the World Bank, to help
            unblock the tourism infrastructure activity in the project.
